metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1538 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the nsTextEditRules::CreateMozBR functionin Mozilla Firefox before 30.0, Firefox ESR 24.x before 24.6, andThunderbird before 24.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codeor cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via unspecifiedvectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-globalmenu - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-testsuite - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
